data.text: An instrument for examining the interior structures of the eye, especially the retina, consisting essentially of a mirror that reflects light into the eye and a central hole through which the eye is examined.
data.attributionText: from The American HeritageÂ® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An instrument for viewing the interior of the eye, especially for examining the retina.
To view the eye by means of the ophthalmoscope.

An instrument for viewing the interior of the eye, particularly the retina. Light is thrown into the eye by a mirror (usually concave) and the interior is then examined with or without the aid of a lens.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.
from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: medical instrument for examining the retina of the eye
